website_summaries.verdict: Compact, ergonomically  designed, and lightweight, this rotary hammer promises better battery life, cool operation, and greater versatility in applications.
pros: Large 2-finger trigger makes it comfortable to use
Delivers up to twice the drilling speed as compared to other 18V cordless rotary hammers
Electronically controlled brushless motor optimizes battery performance
cons: Replacement batteries are expensive (requires a set of two)

customer_reviews.title: Corded performance, cordless convenience.
customer_reviews.text: I love this tool. Works as well as a corded bulldog but no cord to hassle with. I use this daily in high rise construction and it kicks major a$$. Helps me work much quicker and more efficiently. I definitely recommend it to anyone considering it, especially if you already have makita batteries. I have definitely put it through it’s paces and it still works as well as the day I bought it. If it breaks, however, I wouldn’t hesitate to buy another.
customer_reviews.author: urdaddy

customer_reviews.title: Very surprised and happy
customer_reviews.text: Wow. Totally outperforms the corded Bosch SDS MAX demo/hammer drill I've used for 10 years. It has a reverse, but I have yet to get a bit stuck with this drill. Expensive with the charger/batteries. Now that I see how great it is... I'd probably pay double if I had to. It's well worth the $.
customer_reviews.author: mjs

customer_reviews.title: I'm returning mine because it burned up after drilling only ...
customer_reviews.text: I'm returning mine because it burned up after drilling only 5 holes in a rock. Amazon is sending a replacement and I hope to be able to report back that this was just a defective item because I've never had an issue with my many other Makita tools. Amazon quickly sent a replacement and I'm happy to say, the drill appears to work fine after drilling some substantial holes in granite boulders. Changed by review from 1 to four stars after replacement.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Cut the cord
customer_reviews.text: I tried the 18v (single battery) 1st and it couldn’t chip stucco for patching. This 36v (two battery) did it almost on par with my corded Bosch bulldog.
customer_reviews.author: Jon Karner

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Works great, light enough to pack and hike, decent battery life. Chews through the tough material, even jade.
customer_reviews.author: JG

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Full of power! I have 4 batteries and a double changer. Keeps up with the job.
customer_reviews.author: David Deponty

customer_reviews.title: If you're considering this tool, don't hesitate.
customer_reviews.text: I couldn't be happier with this purchase from price, to speedy shipping, to tool performance. Running an extension cord for my rotary hammer is a problem of the past.
customer_reviews.author: Chadwick

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely amazing tool. Everybody wants to use it because of ...
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely amazing tool. Everybody wants to use it because of its portable and comment on it 2 battery set up all the time. I've now had it 2yrs and use it all the time
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great power! Haven't used it a whole lot but runs through concrete like butter.
customer_reviews.author: Cooper Waite

customer_reviews.title: Haven't used it much but it works great. The price was fantastic
customer_reviews.text: Out performs two of my corded drills. Haven't used it much but it works great. The price was fantastic.
customer_reviews.author: Tom Durrant

customer_reviews.title: well made tool
customer_reviews.text: a monster of a drill ! very powerful with 2- 5amp 18volt batteries
customer_reviews.author: Iron Brian

customer_reviews.title: makita hammer drill battery opp
customer_reviews.text: With new bits in it, it blasted through concrete as good, if not better, than my old corded one. Makin a spot for it in the work truck,.
customer_reviews.author: roger stock

customer_reviews.title: Very Satisfied
customer_reviews.text: This Tool turned out much better than expected!! Strong and gets the job done!!
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca

customer_reviews.title: trash
customer_reviews.text: i can not beleive makita made such a terrible roto hammer burned out after vjust
customer_reviews.author: Alfonso Valdivia

customer_reviews.title: Great tool!
customer_reviews.text: My new favorite tool. I bought this specific rotary hammer based on my need and the reviews and articles I read. Not to mention it shares the same batteries with a my Makita wireless drill. I can say that this unit is very robust and far more powerful than I would have imagined. Very happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Rich

customer_reviews.title: It's a monster
customer_reviews.text: Wished I had broke down and bought it sooner. Excellent tool and excellent quality.
customer_reviews.author: Kapdon

customer_reviews.title: It's a monster
customer_reviews.text: This tool has incredible power and runtime. It positively blows my corded 1" rotary hammer away. Hard to beleive I know but this is amazing. I had the 36v Hilti TE-6A and it was great but this walks all over it. And for a lot less money! I do wish this worked with the hepa vac dust extractor like the brushless 18v model does.
customer_reviews.author: Toolpig

customer_reviews.title: Excellent tool
customer_reviews.text: I use this drill to set anchor bolts in block walls, etc. It's been a great replacement for my corded version- much easier to use on jobsites where power is minimal. Excellent quality, highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Eric

product_meta.title: Makita XRH05Z 18V X2 LXT Lithium-Ion (36V) Cordless 1-Inch Rotary Hammer, accepts SDS-PLUS bits, Tool Only
product_meta.description:
Style:Tool onlyThe Makita 18V X2 LXT Lithium-Ion (36V) Cordless 1" Rotary Hammer (model XRH05Z, tool only) is powered by two 18V LXT batteries, delivering the power and run time for corded demands without leaving the 18V platform. With 3 Joules of Impact Energy and 4,800 BPM, the XRH05Z Rotary Hammer is engineered to meet the demands of corded 1" drilling and hammering concrete applications without having to drag around a cord. The XRH05Z Rotary Hammer delivers up to twice the drilling speed of 18V rotary hammers, with up to three times as many holes drilled. The XRH05Z has a 1" drilling capacity (accepts SDS-PLUS bits) with 0-4,800 BPM, 0-1,200 RPM, and a full 3.0 Joules of impact energy. The XRH05Z has features common to Makita's broad line of rotary hammers including 3-mode operation, one-touch sliding chuck, and a torque limiting clutch engineered to prevent gear damage by automatically disengaging gears if the bit binds.

SET CONTAINS:
Side Handle (450990-1); Depth Gauge (324219-0); Tool Bag
feature_bullets: 18 Volt Solution for Corded Power Demands
Two 18V LXT Lithium-Ion batteries deliver the power and run time for corded demands without leaving the 18V LXT platform
Makita-built motor delivers 0-1,250 RPM, 0-5,000 BPM and 3.0 Joules of impact energy for fast drilling
Vibration-absorbing handle engineered for increased operator comfort
Ergonomic soft-grip handle and large 2-finger trigger provide increased comfort on the job

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.2 out of 5 stars26 ratings4.2 out of 5 stars
